bibl.title: The Life and Work of Francis Willey Kelsey: Archaeology, Antiquity, and the Arts.
bibl.note: Introduction. - Setting the stage. - Apprenticeship. Lake Forest University. - Quickening the pace. The first decade at Michigan. 1899-1900. - A man of many parts. 1900-1906. - A national profile. Kelsey and the Archaeological Institute of America. - A regional presence. Kelsey close to home, 1907-1912. - Leading the way. 1913-1918. - The first expedition (1919-1921). Battlefield and manuscripts [see in part. pp. 270-276: Egypt and Italy; - 296-300: The papyri]. - The second expedition (1921-1927). Kelsey on the move [see in part. pp. 315-318: From Turkey to Egypt to Italy to London]. - The final passage [see in part 375-391: In Egypt and Karanis: An excursive chronicle.]
bibl.seg: Pedley John Griffith, The Life and Work of Francis Willey Kelsey: Archaeology, Antiquity, and the Arts.
Ann Arbor, University of Michigan Press, 2012, 8Â°, xii-468 pp., 1 portrait, 36 figg. ISBN 978-0-472-11802-1. $75.

Introduction. - Setting the stage. - Apprenticeship. Lake Forest University. - Quickening the pace. The first decade at Michigan. 1899-1900. - A man of many parts. 1900-1906. - A national profile. Kelsey and the Archaeological Institute of America. - A regional presence. Kelsey close to home, 1907-1912. - Leading the way. 1913-1918. - The first expedition (1919-1921). Battlefield and manuscripts [see in part. pp. 270-276: Egypt and Italy; - 296-300: The papyri]. - The second expedition (1921-1927). Kelsey on the move [see in part. pp. 315-318: From Turkey to Egypt to Italy to London]. - The final passage [see in part 375-391: In Egypt and Karanis: An excursive chronicle.]
